name: Green Merino/Silk Hat
description: This hat is a blend of 4 different green shades of Merino blended with white silk that I had blended by someone else.  I spun the yarn on my spinning wheel, here in my home, just below the arctic circle in northern Canada.  I crocheted the hat and it is approximately 23 inches in circumference and about 8 inches tall.  It is hand wash only and lay flat to dry.  This hat is soft to the touch.

name: Brown And Green Alpaca/Silk Hat
description:
This hat was made with Yukon-raised rose-grey alpaca that I bought raw and washed and prepared myself.  I blended it with some Bombyx silk that I had dyed with osage orange and then over-dyed with indigo.  I spun the blend on my spinning wheel and crocheted it into this hat.  The hat will be warm but has nice drape and is very soft.  

The circumference of the hat is about 22 inches around and is about 8 inches tall.  The turned up brim is about 2 inches tall.  It has a tassel as seen in the photos.

name: Pink Naturally-Dyed Wool Hat
description:
I bought the fleece used for this hat off of a shepherd in Saskatchewan, Canada.  I used a natural dye to dye it this delicate shade of pink and then carded the wool myself.  I spun it up on my spinning wheel and crocheted it into this hat.

It is approximately 22 inches in circumference at the bottom of the hat but fuller around the crown.  The height is around 8 inches tall with a 1 inch turned up brim.

name: Teal Wool Bag
description: This is a wool bag made from fibre I purchased from another small business.  The batt was mainly blues and greens which made a lovely multi-coloured yarn that I crocheted into this bag.  I lined it with a cotton lining.
